document_data.name: Cape Velen
document_data.mainbody: '''Cape Velen''' was a lightly-populated duchy in [[Tethyr]] ruled in [[1369 DR]] by [[Llachior Blackthorn|Duke Llachior Blackthorn]].
document_data.Geography:
Cape Velen encompassed the [[Dragon's Neck Peninsula]], which was also called the Velen Peninsula or the Tethyr Peninsula. Most of the settled land was on the coast; the interior of the peninsula was forested and connected to the [[Forest of Tethir]] to the east.

This duchy contained the counties of [[Firedrake (county)|Firedrake]], [[Fyraven]], and [[Greenshores]].
document_data.Government:
Duke Llachior Blackthorn ruled the Cape from castle [[Tordraken]].

After the successful succession from Tethyr, [[Duke Calchais]] rules over the small now independent duchy.
document_data.History:
The founding clans of Tethyr originated in this part of the country.

The coast of Cape Velen was struck by an immense tidal wave on [[Midsummer]] Night in the {{YearlinkName|-133}}. The flooding killed a large percentage of the population of the peninsula, including all the members of [[Clan Tarseth]], and destroyed the city of [[Velen]].

In [[1424 DR]] they declared their independence from the Tethyr and became an autonomous duchy. Velen had become isolated from the rest of Tethyr due to the founding of [[Muranndin]] which cut off their land-based routes of travel to the larger kingdom. Initially this created tension with Tethyr, but over time relations between the two realms were re-established and they considered one another as allies.
document_data.Rumors:
Cape Velen was said to have been infested with ghosts. The people living there, however, did not seem much bothered by this.

By 1369 DR, the [[Twisted Rune]] had placed a magical gate in the area to allow for instantaneous movement to other locations.
